name: Searchable Player
description: Upload your mp3s to your WP Media Library and stream them through smart speakers. With search and sort order capabilities.

properties.comment: You can view all the available commands in the fragment below

properties.text: Loop is currently ${media_info.loop_status ? 'on':'off'}, and shuffle is ${media_info.shuffle_status ? 'on':'off'}.
Oh and by the way, you can ask me turn shuffle or loop on during audio playback.
Oh wow! Something weird happened and  I couldn't find any playable tracks!
Currently, you're on track ${ media_info.song_no}: <break time="350ms"/>${media_info.current.songTitle}
, by ${media_info.current.getArtist()}.
You're on track ${ media_info.song_no} out of total ${media_info.count}.
Sorry, I might have wax in my ears.
or perhaps restarting the service might do the trick.
Hmm, I can play specific tracks,<break time="350ms"/> play the last track, or <break time="350ms"/>start over. How can I help?
Well, I wish I could, but it seems there's no next track to play.
Hmm, I wish I could, but there's no previous track to play.
Sorry, not sure about that one.
You can play a track by, title, author, or genre. Just say something like, "Alexa, tell ${SERVICE_NAME} to play Bach". <break time="1s"/>
To return to the first track, simply say 'Alexa, start over'.
To play the next track, simply say 'Alexa, next'.
To start, or resume audio playback, simply open ${SERVICE_NAME}.
Something weird just happened with ${SERVICE_NAME}. Here's the error message: <break time="350ms" />${error.getMessage()}
Hmm, something weird happened and I couldn't resume your playback.
It might be a playlist issue, or disabling and enabling the service again might do the trick.

properties.comment: ALEXA INVOCATION +  AVAILABLE DURING PLAYBACK
You can say "Alexa, tell [skill name] to play the last song"
You can say, "Alexa, ask [skill name] to play [singer_name]"
You can say, "Alexa, tell [skill name] to play [song_name]"
You can say, "Alexa, tell [skill name] to play [folder_name]"
You can say, "Alexa, tell [skill name] to play [genre]"
You can say, "Alexa, tell [skill name] to play all my music"
You can say "Alexa, ask [skill name] what's playing"
You can say "Alexa, ask [skill name] how many tracks are there"
You can say "Alexa, ask [skill name] what's the player status"
You can say "Alexa, tell [skill name] to rewind [num] seconds"
You can say "Alexa, tell [skill name] to fast forward [num] seconds"
You can say "Alexa, tell [skill name] to go [num] tracks backward/forward"
You can say "Alexa, tell [skill name] to go to the track number [num]"
You can say "Alexa, tell [skill name] to play tracks in alphabetical order"
You can say "Alexa, tell [skill name] to play the latest tracks first"
You can say "Alexa, ask [skill name] for help"
COMMANDS AVAILABLE ONLY DURING AUDIO PLABACK
You can say "Alexa, start over" to return to the first track
You can say "Alexa, next" for the next track
You can say "Alexa, previous" for the previous track
You can say "Alexa, resume".
You can say "Alexa, pause".
You can say "Alexa, repeat"
You can say "Alexa, shuffle on" to turn on shuffle
You can say "Alexa, shuffle off" to turn off shuffle
You can say "Alexa, loop on".
You can say "Alexa, loop off".
Previous search now returns no results and should be reset

properties.text: Playing track number ${track_no}.

properties.comment: First track message
Only track - search cleanup in case of an error

properties.text: Starting the first track.

properties.comment: Last track message

properties.text: Playing the last ${last_media_info.current.artist} track.
Playing the last track.

properties.comment: Only track - search cleanup in case of an error
Neither the first nor last - continuation  message

properties.name: Continuing from where you left off

properties.text: Continuing from where you left off.

properties.comment: Resume playing other tracks, after the searched for track

properties.text: Hmm, I couldn't find ${search} in your audio files.
But I hear ${last_media_info.current.songTitle}
, by ${last_media_info.current.artist}
is pretty dope.
Hmm, I couldn't find a playlist folder called ${search_folders}.
Hmm,  I couldn't find anything like that in your  folders!

properties.comment: Continue from the last track, not track index
If this doesn't work, continue from the last index

properties.name: Error message - no results, try disabling the service

properties.text: Whaddaya know! Something happened, and I can't play any tracks! You can try disabling the service and enabling it again.

properties.name: Error message - can't play that track

properties.text: Hmm, something happened and I can't play that track.

properties.name: Error message - can't play any tracks

properties.text: Sorry, something weird happened and I can't play any tracks.

properties.name: Go to Song by Number, Position

properties.comment: The number outnumbers total tracks

properties.text: Hmm, can't play track ${track_no}. We have ${media_info.count} in total. And I hear track ${media_info.count} is pretty dope.

properties.comment: Trying to go too far back

properties.text: Hmm, can't go that far back. You're on track number ${media_info.song_no}.
Hmm, can't go that much forward. Not enough tracks.
Hmm, can't skip that much ahead. Not enough tracks.
Sorry, something weird happened and I can't find any tracks to play.

properties.comment: Transfer Intent to search string we can use
Get raw value

properties.text: Playing in alphabetical order.
Playing from the most recently added track.
